BERWICK – Berwick Area High School standout football player Teagan Wilk has been named to the PIAA Class AAAA All-State 1st team for the 2nd consecutive year. Wilk, a 5-11. 180 lb. junior, was recognized as a defensive back.

Wilk led the Wyoming Valley Conference in interceptions in 2018 with seven, including one which was returned for a touchdown. He had 85 tackles on the year, with 62 of them being solo tackles. He also had 23 receptions for 214 yards and rushed for 197 yards and 5 touchdowns.

Wilk was recognized as the top sophomore defensive back in Pennsylvania in 2017 and is receiving significant recruiting interest. He was one of the leaders of a Bulldog squad, which finished 9-3 in 2018.

DOYLESTOWN, PA. – Damon Beckhorn recently became the latest Berwick Bulldog football standout to make his college commitment with the announcement that he will attend Delaware Valley University in the fall. Beckhorn led the Dawgs in receiving with 42 receptions for 586 yards and 7 touchdowns last year.
He was also third on the team with 211 yards rushing and 3 touchdowns. Defensively, he had 41 total tackles with 11 being for loss, along with 2 fumble recoveries, 2 interceptions and 3 sacks. He was named to the District 2 first All-Star team and the Wilkes-Barre Citizens Voice First Team. He was also named to the Northeast Pennsylvania Football site 1st team Offense and Defense and the Press Enterprise 1st All-Star Team.
The Delaware Valley University Aggies compete in NCAA Division III and are in the Middle Atlantic Conference.

STASHKO RECEIVES HONOR AT PSU
UNIVERSITY PARK, PA. – Berwick Area High School Class of 2014 graduate Ryan Stashko was recently named to the prestigious Lunar Lion Team at Penn State University. The Lunar Lion Team is the only University sponsored, student run organization in the world with the goal of sending a functional spacecraft to the Moon.
Founded in 2013, the team has progressed quickly toward their goal of developing a spacecraft that can properly land, take data and takeoff from the lunar surface.
The Lunar Lion team receives about 100 applications each year, with about 10-20 of those applicants being accepted. Mr. Stashko was recently selected to be a full-time member of Lunar Lion working with the structures subsystem. The function of structures is to focus on the materials and design aspect of the craft and ensure that it can withstand the tremendous stress of space travel.
Ryan Stashko is a junior at Penn State, majoring in Mechanical Engineering. He has a projected graduation date of 2018.

BERWICK WINS UNIVERSITY OF SCRANTON PHYSICS COMPETITION

BERWICK – Two Berwick Area High School Physics Teams took 1st and Third Place at the “Kane” Physics Competition yesterday at the University of Scranton.

The event attracted 31 teams from more than a dozen Northeastern Pennsylvania schools, with teams competing in several physics demonstrations involving Projectile Motion, Harmonic Motion with a Pendulum, Momentum and Collisions and Energy Loss. Participants also competed in the “Kane” Quiz that featured problems in Mechanics, Optics, and Electromagnetism.

In the final “Back to the Future” themed event, the Berwick – 1 Team completed a three-stage problem-solving and building task to take 1st of the 31 teams.

Berwick Senior Spencer Yacuboski finished in the top three of the “Kane” Quiz and was invited to compete in the “Physics Jeopardy” event, where he placed 2nd. The Berwick – 1 Team (pictured) consisted of: Emily Dent, Olivia Lombardi, Jacob Demler, Mason Kimbell, Madi Traugh, Spencer Yacuboski, and Zach Mensinger. Matthew Shrader coached the team.

BERWICK STUDENTS RECONGNIZED AT NATIONAL HISTORY DAY COMPETITION

DALLAS – Berwick Area Middle School students Lexi Comuntzis, Owen Berlin, Jack Dacier, Megan Golomb, Tanner Allen, Taylor Woodeshick, Justin Walker, Olivia Gomez and Grace Ward displayed their historical research at the 2017 Region 2 National History Day competition held at Misericordia University on Saturday March 25th.
Students conducted and displayed research on historical persons fitting the theme of the event “Taking a Stand,” and ranged from musician Louie Armstrong to aviator Amelia Earhardt to Oscar Schindler and Rylee Simpson with their exhibit on “Harry Truman and the bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.”
Olivia Gomez took 1st place in Region 2 for her website documenting Mississippi Civil Rights Leader Medgar Evers and will present her research at the State History Day event in Carlisle in May.

BERWICK ADVANCES THREE TO STATE SWIM MEET

LEWISBURG – Berwick Area High School will have three representatives at the Pennsylvania State Interscholastic Athletic (PIAA) swim meet at Bucknell University this week. Freshman Sydney Lloyd and senior Becca Decker will compete in the girls’ competition and senior Chris Michael will compete in the boys’ event.
The trio reached the state event through their efforts at the District 2 championships last week. Lloyd and Decker qualified by finishing as district runners-up in the 200 freestyle and the 100 breaststroke, respectively. Michael placed 3rd in the 100 breaststroke and met the qualifying standard for states.
The Bulldog swimmers, currently coached by Stacy Demshock, haven’t had a female swimmer reach states since 2008, or a male swimmer since 2010.

LADY BULLDOGS ADVANCE TO SWEET 16

WILKES BARRE – The Berwick Area Lady Bulldogs advanced to the state “Sweet 16” with a thrilling 37-36 win over Jersey Shore here Friday evening. Tori Talanca’s shot at the buzzer capped a furious rally which saw Berwick overcome a four-point deficit in the last 10 seconds to advance in the Pennsylvania Interscholastic Athletic Association (PIAA) Class AAAA Tournament.
Reese Mensinger hit a three pointer with about 10 seconds to play and following a turnover, Berwick set up a play with less than a second left in the game. Talanca’s buzzer-beater sent the Lady Bulldogs into a second round game against District 1 champion Lower Moreland at Hamburg High School tomorrow evening at 7:30 p.m., weather permitting.

With the win, Berwick’s record is now 17-9. The loss ends the season of the Jersey Shore Lady Bulldogs, who were the third place team from District 4.
